page.title: 16Taunton Cider - Process
page.content: Taunton Cider Co. contracts 18 acres of apple orchards to provide a variety of apples such as bitter sweet, sweet, sharp, and bitter sharp. These are brought in during the autumn and pressed to produce 1200 litres of juice from each tonne of fruit. The 15% of pomace that remains is sold as cattle food to local farmers. During natural fermentation a special yeast is used and it is stored in oak vats. The amount of sugar added to the fermenting liquid depends on the natural content of the apple which will vary according to the weather. The fermenting liquids are blended depending on the product required. Cider - if kept below 8.5% alcohol by volume - is taxed at a lower rate than beer, and Taunton Cider produces a whole range from Diamond White (8.2%) to the new Piermont soft drink.
